item.title: Report E-2024080145
item.description:
Report E-2024080145

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to load shift. Clean Harbors personnel neutralized, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged boxes, jugs, and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024080140
item.description:
Report E-2024080140

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 14000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the trailer floor and a 25ft by-23ft area of the asphalt underneath the trailer and estimated that twenty-five (25) gallons of material was released due to the tractor size battery tipping over during transit. Clean Harbors personnel neutralized and cleaned the impacted areas. The battery, impacted pallet, and absorbents were containerized for disposal.
